message_1: Let X be the unit sphere in three-dimensional space, and let p: X → S² be the standard projection map. Determine the fundamental group of S² \ {p((1, 0, 0))}.
message_2:
To determine the fundamental group of S² \ {p((1, 0, 0))}, we first need to understand the space we are working with. S² is the 2-dimensional sphere, and p((1, 0, 0)) is the projection of the point (1, 0, 0) from the unit sphere X onto S². So, S² \ {p((1, 0, 0))} is the 2-dimensional sphere with one point removed.

Now, we can use the fact that the fundamental group of a space is invariant under deformation retraction. We can continuously deform S² \ {p((1, 0, 0))} into a circle S¹ by pushing the remaining points of the sphere towards the equator. Since the fundamental group of the circle S¹ is isomorphic to the integers (Z), the fundamental group of S² \ {p((1, 0, 0))} is also isomorphic to the integers (Z).

Therefore, the fundamental group of S² \ {p((1, 0, 0))} is Z.
